summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, sent on November 29, 2021, to colleagues regarding the upcoming trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. It expresses confidence in the prosecution, frames the case as a pursuit of justice for historical sex crimes, and provides logistical details for the trial's opening day.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The central defendant in the criminal trial, accused of sexually exploiting underage girls.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The author of the email, rallying colleagues to support the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell and expressing confidence in the case.

connections.description: The prosecutor is leading the legal case against the defendant, Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Trial of Ghislaine Maxwell Opens
events.description: The opening day of the criminal trial against Ghislaine Maxwell, involving peremptory challenges, preliminary instructions, and opening statements.

keyFacts: The document is a motivational email from a prosecutor on the eve of Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.
The prosecution asserts that Ghislaine Maxwell sexually exploited underage girls, causing them unspeakable harm.
The email contrasts the Southern District of New York's willingness to prosecute historical sex crimes with an implied criticism of prosecutors in Florida.
The trial is scheduled to begin with jury selection and opening statements on November 29, 2021.
Multiple courtrooms and a conference room are designated for overflow viewing, indicating high interest in the trial.
